snippet: “Every time I think about those kids, it gets me mad,” the president said, discussing the victims of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting.
abstract: Pres Obama, in tearful and emotion-laden speech, condemns shootings that have swept America and vows to curb gun violence with or without Congress's cooperation; Obama faces numerous logistical, legal and political barriers to executive actions he has planned, which are limited in scope, and administration admits it is difficult to gauge potential effect of proposed steps.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: “Every time I think about those kids, it gets me mad,” the president said, discussing the victims of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting.

headline.main: Tearful Obama Outlines Steps to Curb Gun Deaths
headline.print_headline: Tearful Obama Outlines Steps to Curb Gun Deaths
